intro: Strobilanthes integrifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved makepeace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped, smooth-edged leaves. The plant produces showy, two-lipped flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
